column2: The fragile bones are protected by legion armour.
Built in the style of the Tomb Kings, only the highest officers of the Dread Legion will take to the battlefield on top of this chariot.
A Warsphinx brought by a traitor king into the service of Nagash.
The Hand of Nagash is infamous an infamous charioteer. Now that he is resurrected and has regained his chariot, only misery awaits the living in his path.

An enemy so hated by the Hand that he was strapped on a halberd and is used as a battlestandard even after death. Those who came close enough and survived swear that the skeleton still screams in agony. Without a sound, yet unbearably loud.
A gift from Nagash himself. When its wielder fades, the blade awakens and feeds him with the life force of its victims so he may persist against all odds.
